trans-unit.source: Media Services quotas and limitation
trans-unit.target: Media Services quotas and limitation

trans-unit.source: This topic describes quotas and limitations associated with Microsoft Azure Media Services.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes quotas and limitations associated with Microsoft Azure Media Services.

trans-unit.source: Quotas and Limitations
trans-unit.target: Quotas and Limitations

trans-unit.source: This topic describes quotas and limitations associated with Microsoft Azure Media Services.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes quotas and limitations associated with Microsoft Azure Media Services.

trans-unit.source: Quotas and limitations
trans-unit.target: Quotas and limitations

trans-unit.source: Other limitations
trans-unit.target: Other limitations

trans-unit.source: Media Services throttling mechanism restricts the resource usage for applications that make excessive request to the service.
trans-unit.target: Media Services throttling mechanism restricts the resource usage for applications that make excessive request to the service.

trans-unit.source: The service may return the Service Unavailable (503) HTTP status code.
trans-unit.target: The service may return the Service Unavailable (503) HTTP status code.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see the description of the 503 error in the <link><linkText>Azure Media Services Error Codes</linkText><title></title></link> topic.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see the description of the 503 error in the <link><linkText>Azure Media Services Error Codes</linkText><title></title></link> topic.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>How to request a higher limit for updatable quotas
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>How to request a higher limit for updatable quotas

trans-unit.source: Updatable quotas
trans-unit.target: Updatable quotas

trans-unit.source: You can request to update the limits for the following quotas by opening a support ticket.
trans-unit.target: You can request to update the limits for the following quotas by opening a support ticket.

trans-unit.source: Encoding units
trans-unit.target: Encoding units

trans-unit.source: Live channels (in stopped and running state)
trans-unit.target: Live channels (in stopped and running state)

trans-unit.target: Streaming endpoints (in stopped and running state)

trans-unit.source: Streaming units
trans-unit.target: Streaming units

trans-unit.source: Open a support ticket
trans-unit.target: Open a support ticket

trans-unit.source: To open a support ticket do the following:
trans-unit.target: To open a support ticket do the following:

trans-unit.source: Click <link><linkText>Get Support</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Click <link><linkText>Get Support</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: If you are not logged in, you will be prompted to enter your credentials.
trans-unit.target: If you are not logged in, you will be prompted to enter your credentials.

trans-unit.source: Select your subscription.
trans-unit.target: Select your subscription.

trans-unit.source: Under support type, select "Technical".
trans-unit.target: Under support type, select "Technical".

trans-unit.source: Click on "Create Ticket".
trans-unit.target: Click on "Create Ticket".

trans-unit.source: Select "Azure Media Services" in the product list presented on the next page.
trans-unit.target: Select "Azure Media Services" in the product list presented on the next page.

trans-unit.source: Select a "Problem type" that is appropriate for your issue.
trans-unit.target: Select a "Problem type" that is appropriate for your issue.

trans-unit.source: Click Continue.
trans-unit.target: Click Continue.

trans-unit.source: Follow instructions on next page and then enter details about your issue.
trans-unit.target: Follow instructions on next page and then enter details about your issue.

trans-unit.source: Click submit to open the ticket.
trans-unit.target: Click submit to open the ticket.

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
